original_title: Sri Lanka Treasury bill yields up at auction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s 3 and 12 month Treasuries yields rose at Wednesday’s auction data from the state debt office showed.
The 3-month yield rose 68 basis points to 24.80 percent. The debt office offered 60 billion rupees of bills and sold 52 billion rupees.
The 6-month yield was flat at 24.10 percent. 20 billion rupees in bills were offered at 24.10 was sold.
The 12-month yield rose 27 basis points to 22.64 percent. 40 billion rupees were offered and only 19.4 billion rupees were sold. (Colombo/Apr11/2023)
